text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Monday:

- Jewish organisations said that they planned sanctions against Swiss banks as a reaction to comments of former Swiss president Delamuraz. Before his term expired at end-1996, he accused foreign critics of blackmailing Switzerland over the issue of compensation for Jews who might be entitled to money left in Swiss banks after World War Two.
- A widow of a holocaust refugee has alleged that Swiss Bank Corp had been remiss in its treatment of her husband's account. The bank rejected the allegations.
- Swiss parliament will discuss a draft of a new Swiss constitution in 1997.
- The city of Basle plans to introduce a new law that will forbit 'aggressive' street advertising methods of the Scientology organisaiton.
- Swiss Finance Minister Kaspar Villiger said in an interview with Swiss Sunday newspaper 'Le Matin' that he did not believe tax increases would help put federal finances back in good shape.
